intro: Rubus infestus microgene euchloos, commonly known as the Pacific blackberry, is a species of brambles native to the western coast of North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in coastal regions and river valleys. Due to its aggressive growth habit, it can become invasive in certain ecosystems.
